newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian rubber down on soft demand.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian rubber down on soft demand.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended lower on technical adjustments and soft consumer demand, traders said.
The Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted April RSS1 buyer at 299.50 cents ($1.21) a kg, down half cent from Friday. April SMR20 buyer ended one cent lower at 285.50.
Traders offered the SMR20 at 287 cents a kg, SMR CV at 354, SMR L at 334, SMR 5 at 293, SMR 10 at 288 and drum latex FOB at 235.
"It was a quiet Monday," said a trader. Checks with several trading houses showed no inquiries or business concluded.
Traders had said on Friday they did not rule out possibility of a further retreat in prices this week.
"The market looks quite low, but it's difficult to predict. It can go lower given the lack of demand," said a trader.
The INRO five-day average was at 229.91 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on March 21 from 230.48 on March 20. The daily indicator was at 229.12 from 229.17.
